data.title: Historical Figures Who Died on September 22
data.meta_description: Famous deaths in history for the 22nd of September. See which outlaws, philosophers and historical figures passed away on September 22.
data.text:
Ouyang Xiu, Chinese historian and scholar-official (b. 1007)

Olaf III, King of Norway (1067-93), founder of Bergen, dies at about 43

Petrus Cantor, French theologist (Verbum Abbreviatum), dies

Dōgen, Japanese Buddhist priest and founder of the Sōtō school of Zen, dies at 53

Mugaku Sogen, Zen Rinzai line founder of Engakuji temple, dies at 60

Henry Plantagenet, 3rd Earl of Leicester (b. 1281)

Aleid van Poelgeest, mistress of Albert I of Bavaria, murdered in The Hague by warring nobles at 22

1392 Willem Cuser, court squire to Albert I of Bavaria, murdered in The Hague by warring nobles

Thomas de Mowbray, 1st Duke of Norfolk, English politician (b. 1366)

Johannes VII Palaeologus, Byzantine Emperor (1376-77, 90/1404-8), dies

Selim I 'Selim the Grim', Sultan of Turkey (1512-20) who captured Baghdad and Cairo, dies at 53

Louise Van Savoye, French regent of King Francis I, dies at 55

Guru Nanak

Founder of the religion of Sikhism and the 1st Sikh Guru, dies at 70

Francisco Vázquez de Coronado

Spanish explorer and conquistador who led 1st European expedition to discover the Grand Canyon, dies of disease at about 44

John Agricola [Schneider], German theologian, a friend of Martin Luther, dies at 72

Alessandro Allori, Italian Mannerist painter and director of the Florentine carpet factory, dies at 72

Georg Philipp Harsdörffer, German poet and translator, dies at 50

John Biddle, English theologian (b. 1615)

Hoessein Koprulu, Turkish great vizer (peace of Karlowitz), dies

Vincenzo Viviani, Italian mathematician (Viviani's theorem), dies at 81

Pope Clement XIV [Giovanni Ganganelli], Pope (1769-74), dies at 68

Nathan Hale

American Revolutionary War patriot, "I only regret that I have but one life to give for my country", hanged by the British for spying at 21

John Bartram, American naturalist and explorer, father of American botany, dies at 77

Johann Peter Hebel, German writer (Allemannische Gedichte), dies at 66

Shaka, South African Zulu king, founder of the Zulu nation, murdered (b. c. 1787)

Anne Lister, English diarist 'the 1st modern lesbian', dies of a fever at 49

1840 Princess Augusta Sophia of the United Kingdom, 6th child and second daughter of King George III and Queen Charlotte, dies at 71

William Tierney Clark, English civil engineer, dies at 69

Heinrich Christian Pander, Baltic German biologist and embryologist, dies at 71

Vladimir Dal, Russian lexicographer (Explanatory Dictionary of the Living Great Russian Language), dies at 70

Friedrich Frey-Herosé, Swiss politician, dies at 62

Solomon L. Spink, U.S. Congressman from Illinois (b. 1831)

Johanna D. Courtmans-Berchmans, Flemish author (Rozeken Pot), dies at 79

Charles-Denis Bourbaki, French general (Crimean War, Franco-Prussian war), dies at 81

Alain-Fournier, French writer (Le Grand Meaulnes), dies in battle at 27

Ivan Vazov, Bulgarian poet, novelist and playwright (Under the Yoke), dies at 71

Marquess of Ripon, English aristocrat and game hunter, dies, after shooting 52nd grouse in one morning at 71

Cecil Chubb, English barrister, gifted monument Stonehenge to the British nation, dies at 58

Ralph Adams Cram, American gothic architect (Cathedral of St Joan NYC), dies at 78

"Cab" Calloway, British scout, dies in battle of Oosterbeek

Kim Jong-suk, Wife of Kim Il-sung, mother of Kim Jung-Il, "The Heroine of the Anti-Japanese Revolution", dies at 31

Ian Hay [John Hay Beith], British novelist and playwright (Pip, Carrying On), dies at 76

1952 Kaarlo Juho Ståhlberg, first President of Finland (b. 1865)

Frederick Soddy

English radiochemist and Nobel laureate (radioactive substances, isotopes), dies at 79

Soemu Toyoda, Japanese admiral during World War II, dies at 72

Mary Roberts Rinehart, American mystery writer and playwright (The Circular Staircase), dies at 82

Benjamin Peret, French writer and poet (Le grand jeu), dies at 60

1959 Edmund Ironside, 1st Baron Ironside, British fieldmarshal, dies at 79

Melanie Klein, Austrian-British author and child psychoanalyst (object relations theory), dies at 78

Othmar Ammann, Swiss-American bridge engineer (George Washington Bridge; Walt Whitman Bridge; Verrazzano-Narrows Bridge), dies at 86

Adolfo López Mateos, 48th President of Mexico, dies at 59

1969 Aleksandras Stulginskis, Russian-Lithuanian politician, nationalist (President of Lithuania, 1920-26), farmer, and political prisoner (Soviet gulag, 1941-56), dies at 84

Alice Hamilton, American physician, scientist and social advocate (workmen's compensation laws, occupational illnesses), dies at 101 [1]

Robert K.J.E. Antonissen, Belgian-born South African literary figure, dies at 53

Otto Robert Frisch, Austrian-British physicist who coined the term nuclear fission (Manhattan Project), and educator (Cambridge), dies at 74

Axel Springer, German newspaper magnate (Bild Zeitung), dies at 73

Rais Amrohvi, Pakistani poet and psychoanalyst, dies at 74

Pandit Rambharos Gangaram Panday, Suriname religious leader, dies at 91

1991 Reynold Abel Dorris, American Sioux Indian (subject of book "Broken Cord"), dies at 23 after being struck by a car

Margaret MacDonald 'Bobo', Scot-born maid to Queen Elizabeth II, dies at 89

Edward Shackleton, English explorer, geographer and Labour Party politician, dies at 83

1994 Forest 'Bud' Sagendorf, American cartoonist (Popeye), dies at 79

Albert Goodwin, English historian, dies at 89

1995 Arthur Benfield, English celebrated head of Cheshire CID (lead investigation into 'Moors Murders'), dies at 82

Mohammed Ben Amhed Abdelghani, Prime Minister of Algeria (1979-84), dies of a heart attack at 69

Bryan Ingham, English artist, dies at 61

1997 Eric William Hunter Christie, British barrister and Falklands campaigner, dies at 77

1997 George Thomas, 1st Viscount Tonypandy, British politician (Speaker of the House of Commons), dies at 97

1997 Ruth Picardie, English journalist (Before I Say Goodbye), dies of cancer at 33

1997 Shoichi Yokoi, Japanese WW II fighter (surrendered in 1972), dies at 82

Wyndraeth Morris-Jones, British political scientist, dies at 81

Saburo Sakai, Japanese aviator and flying ace of the Imperial Japanese Navy during World War II, dies at 84

2000 Yehuda Amichai, Israeli poet (Now and in Other Days), dies at 76

Jan de Hartog, Dutch-English writer (Holland's Glory), dies at 88

Hugo Young, British journalist (The Guardian), dies at 64

Edward Larrabee Barnes, American architect (Walker Art Center), dies at 89

Thomas Doerflein, German Zookeeper (b. 1963)

David Hubel, Canadian-born American neurologist and Nobel laureate, dies at 87

Edward Anson, Australian British Royal Navy pilot (Korean War), officer (Vice Admiral), and ship captain (HMS Ark Royal), dies at 85

Kjell Albin Abrahamson, Swedish journalist and writer, dies at 71

Jay Sandrich, American Emmy Award-winning television director (The Mary Tyler Moore Show; Soap; The Cosby Show), dies at 89

2021 Roger Michell, British stage and screen director (Blue/Orange; Notting Hill; Hyde Park On Hudson), dies at 65

Brother Andrew [Andrew van der Bijl], Dutch Christian missionary (Open Doors), dies at 94

2022 Hilary Mantel, English novelist (Wolf Hall), dies after a stroke at 70

Giorgio Napolitano, Italian politician, President of Italy (2006-15), dies at 98
